intro: Rechsteineria macrostachya, commonly known as the large-stalked rechsteineria, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Arecaceae, commonly known as the palm family. The plant is characterized by its tall, slender stem and large, pinnately compound leaves. Its inflorescence consists of a large, branched cluster of small, yellowish flowers. Rechsteineria macrostachya is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, growing in humid, well-drained soils.
